intro: Stenostomum reticulare, commonly known as the net-veined stenostomum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, clustered in spikes at the ends of the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Stenostomum reticulare is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and compact growth habit.
